isis.stitle: VT 275 Engine Diagnostics Manual - Electronic Control Systems Diagnostics - Circuit Diagnostics - IDM PWR (Injector Drive Module) Power

figure.caption: Function diagram for IDM PWR supply

table.title: The function Diagram for the IDM PWR includes the following:

svcprocinfo.para: FunctionThe Injector Drive Module (IDM) requires a 12 volt power source. The operating power is received from the vehicle batteries through the IDM main power relay each time the ignition switch is turned ON.
When the ignition switch is turned ON, the IDM provides an internal ground to the coil side of the IDM main power relay. This closes the relay contacts and provides the IDM with power.

svcsubproc.title: IDM PWR Circuit Operation
svcsubproc.para: The IDM is grounded to the battery negative terminal at IDM Pins X3-1, X3-2, X3-3, X3-22 and X3-26.

The IDM receives V IGN power at Pin X3-7. Key power signals the IDM to provide a ground path to switch the IDM power relay from Pin X3-27 to 86. Switching the IDM relay provides power directly from the battery positive terminal through a fuse and relay contacts 30 and 87 to terminals X3-4, X3-23, X3-24 and X3-25. Power is also supplied to Pin X3-8 for IDM logic and is protected with a fuse. See the applicable truck Circuit Diagram Manual for circuit numbers, connector and fuse locations.
Fault Detection/ManagementThe IDM internally monitors battery voltage. When the IDM continuously receives less than 7 volts or greater than 16 volts a Diagnostic Trouble Code (DTC) will be set.
IDM PWR DTCsDTCs are read using the EST or by counting the flashes from the amber and red lamps.

entry.para: DTC 523 is set by the ECM when the voltage from V IGN is less than 7 volts.
DTC 523 can be set due to poor connections between the IDM Pin X3-7 and the V IGN.
DTC 523 will not illuminate the amber lamp (WEL for CF).
DTC 525 is set by the ECM when there is an internal IDM failure. When DTC 525 is set, replace the IDM.
When DTC 525 is active the amber lamp (WEL for CF) is illuminated.
DTC 533 is set by the ECM when the voltage from the IDM power relay is greater than 16 volts.
DTC 533 can be set due to an alternator voltage output of 16 volts or more. DTC 533 can also be set when jump starting the engine or incorrect external battery connections exist.
DTC 523 will not illuminate the amber lamp (WEL for CF).
DTC 534 is set by the ECM when the voltage from the IDM power relay is less than 7 volts.
DTC 534 can be set due to a failed alternator, IDM power relay, discharged batteries or increased resistance in the battery feed circuits.
DTC 534 will not illuminate the amber lamp (WEL for CF).

table.title: Voltage Checks - IDM Power Relay Socket (KOEO)

caution.para: To avoid engine damage, turn ignition switch to OFF before unplugging the connector relay for the IDM. Failure to turn ignition switch to OFF will cause a voltage spike and damage to electrical components.

entry.para: The IDM PWR circuit requires the use of vehicle circuit diagrams. Follow tests in order. Check with IDM relay and breakout harness installed, with ignition switch on and the engine off. If all tests are in spec, proceed to 12-pin voltage checks.
Continuous voltage. If no voltage, check power circuits from battery or fuse. If fuse is blown, check for short to ground. If fuse is good, check for open between PIN 85 and B+.
Continuous voltage. If no voltage, check power circuits from battery or fuse. If fuse is blown, check for short to ground. If fuse is good, check for open between PIN 30 and B+.
If greater than 2 volts, check for open circuit between IDM PIN X3-27 to PIN 86 on relay or V IGN circuit - continue with 12-pin voltage checks.
Continuous voltage. If no voltage, replace relay.

note.para: See the applicable truck Circuit Diagram Manual for circuit numbers, connector and fuse locations.

caution.para: To avoid engine damage, turn ignition switch to OFF before unplugging the connector or relay for the IDM. Failure to turn ignition switch to OFF will cause a voltage spike and damage to electrical components.

entry.para: Check with breakout harness installed at 12-pin connector, IDM relay installed, and KOEO. Follow tests in order. Inspect for bent pins or corrosion.
Power from ignition switch to IDM. If no voltage. Check for blown fuse or open circuit.
IDM MPR - 12-pin connector. If greater than 2 volts, check for open circuit between IDM PIN X3-27 to PIN 8.
IDM power from relay PIN 87. If no voltage, check from PIN 12 to PIN 87 on relay for open or short to ground.
IDM logic power from relay PIN 87 with fuse. If fuse is blown, check for short to ground. If fuse is good, check for open circuit between fuse to PIN 6.
Ground - voltage reading indicates poor ground to battery. If voltage is present check for open or high resistance between battery (-) and IDM pins.

note.para: See the applicable truck Circuit Diagram Manual for circuit numbers, connector and fuse locations.

caution.para: To avoid engine damage, turn ignition switch to OFF before unplugging the connector or relay for the IDM. Failure to turn ignition switch to OFF will cause a voltage spike and damage to electrical components.

entry.para: Check with IDM power relay installed. Disconnect IDM X3 connector. Ground Pin X3-27 using Terminal Test Pin Adapter and harness to activate relay and check at harness connector. Inspect for bent pins or corrosion.
Power from ignition switch to IDM. If no voltage.
Ground - voltage reading indicates poor ground to battery.
Ground - voltage reading indicates poor ground to battery.
Ground - voltage reading indicates poor ground to battery.
Ground - voltage reading indicates poor ground to battery.
Ground - voltage reading indicates poor ground to battery.
IDM grounds relay through internal transistor. Expect 0 volts with X3-27 grounded. If voltage is present, check Terminal Test Pin Adapter and jumper.
Power from relay to IDM. If no voltage, check fuses. If a fuse is blown, check for short to ground. If fuses are good, check for open circuit between 87 and X3-8.
Power from relay to IDM. If no voltage, check for open between PIN X3-4 and 87 on IDM relay.
Power from relay to IDM. If no voltage, check for open between PIN X3-23 and 87 on IDM relay.
Power from relay to IDM. If no voltage, check for open between PIN X3-24 and 87 on IDM relay.
Power from relay to IDM. If no voltage, check for open between PIN X3-25 and 87 on IDM relay.

note.para: See the applicable truck Circuit Diagram Manual for circuit numbers, connector and fuse locations.

table.title: Harness Resistance Checks - Main Power Relay to Battery

warning.para: To avoid personal injury, death, including damage to the engine or vehicle, always disconnect main negative battery cable first. Always connect the main negative battery cable last.

caution.para: To avoid engine damage, turn ignition switch to OFF before unplugging the connector relay for the IDM. Failure to turn ignition switch to OFF will cause a voltage spike and damage to electrical components.

entry.para: Check with ignition switch OFF. Disconnect negative battery cable and IDM X3 harness. IDM harness connector end is numbered at mating end.
If greater than 5 Ω, check connections for open between relay and positive battery cable. Check fuses.
If greater than 5 Ω, check connections for open between relay and positive battery cable. Check fuse.

note.para: See the applicable truck Circuit Diagram Manual for circuit numbers, connector and fuse locations.

table.title: Harness Resistance Checks - IDM to Main Power Relay

caution.para: To avoid engine damage, turn ignition switch to OFF before unplugging the connector relay for the IDM. Failure to turn ignition switch to OFF will cause a voltage spike and damage to electrical components.

entry.para: Turn ignition switch to OFF. Inspect for bent pins or corrosion. Connect relay breakout harness and use Terminal Test Adapter Kit to test. Disconnect IDM X3 (32-pin) connector.

note.para: The mating end of the X3 connector is numbered 1 through 32.

entry.para: If greater than 5 Ω, check connection from IDM to relay.
If greater than 5 Ω, check connection from IDM to relay.
If greater than 5 Ω, check connection from IDM to relay.
If greater than 5 Ω, check connection from IDM to relay.
If greater than 5 Ω, check connection from IDM through fuse to relay.
If greater than 5 Ω, check connection from IDM to relay.

note.para: See the applicable truck Circuit Diagram Manual for circuit numbers, connector and fuse locations.

table.title: Harness Resistance Checks - IDM to Chassis Ground

warning.para: To avoid personal injury, death, including damage to the engine or vehicle, always disconnect main negative battery cable first. Always connect the main negative battery cable last.

entry.para: Turn ignition switch to OFF. Disconnect negative battery cable. Disconnect harness from IDM relay. Use disconnected negative battery cable for ground test point.
If greater than 5 Ω, check connection to battery ground.
If greater than 5 Ω, check connection to battery ground.
If greater than 5 Ω, check connection to battery ground.
If greater than 5 Ω, check connection to battery ground.
If greater than 5 Ω, check connection to battery ground.
If less than 900 Ω, check for short to ground.
If less than 900 Ω, check for short to ground.
If less than 900 Ω, check for short to ground.
If less than 900 Ω, check for short to ground.
If less than 900 Ω, check for short to ground.
If less than 900 Ω, check for short to ground.
If less than 900 Ω, check for short to ground.

note.para: See the applicable truck Circuit Diagram Manual for circuit numbers, connector and fuse locations.

entry.para: DTC 523 = IDM V IGN voltage low
